data.enText: a person who is killed or injured in war or in an accident
data.chText: （战争或事故的）伤员，亡者，遇难者

data.enText: Both sides had suffered heavy casualties (= many people had been killed) .
a person that suffers or a thing that is destroyed when sth else takes place
She became a casualty of the reduction in part-time work (= she lost her job) .
data.chText: 她成了裁减兼职工作的受害人。

data.enText: Small shops have been a casualty of the recession.
data.chText: 小商店在经济萧条中深受其害。

data.enText: the part of a hospital where people who need urgent treatment are taken
The victims were rushed to casualty.
data.chText: 受伤者被迅速送往急救室。

simple_means.memory_skill: casual adj.轻松的 + -ty 名词后缀

means: (战争或事故的)伤员，亡者，遇难者

tr: a decrease of military personnel or equipment
an accident that causes someone to die
someone injured or killed in an accident
someone injured or killed or captured or missing in a military engagement

example.ex: Troops fired on demonstrators near the Royal Palace causing many casualties.
example.tran: 军队在皇宫附近向示威人群开枪，造成大量伤亡。

value.def: A casualty is a person who is injured or killed in a war or in an accident.

example.ex: Fiat has been one of the greatest casualties of the recession.
example.tran: 菲亚特一直是经济萧条中损失最惨重的公司之一。

value.def: A casualty of a particular event or situation is a person or a thing that has suffered badly as a result of that event or situation.

example.ex: I was taken to casualty at St Thomas's Hospital.
example.tran: 我被送往圣·托马斯医院的急救室。

value.def: Casualty is the part of a hospital where people who have severe injuries or sudden illnesses are taken for emergency treatment.

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 emergency room

partsOfSpeech.dec: beau- 美好,美丽 + -ty 名词后缀
plen 充满,填满 + -ty 名词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 自由(自己选择生活方式而不受政府及权威限制)
partsOfSpeech.dec: liber n.契据登记簿 + -ty 名词后缀
certain adj.有把握的 + -ty 名词后缀
loyal adj.忠诚的 + -ty 名词后缀
proper adj.真正的 + -ty 名词后缀
royal adj.国王的 + -ty 名词后缀
novel n.小说 + -ty 名词后缀
